data.title: breakbeatcode
data.text:
BreakBeatCode Hackathon

The BreakBeatCode Hackathon is a free, livestreamed event on Friday, May 31st 10am-2pm ET, with special guest star Supernatural, the GOAT of freestyle hip hop. Students ages 9 and up will learn how to create music with code. No prior coding or music experience required. Students will create their first remixes with code in less than 1 hour, and Supernatural will freestyle over the winning beats in a live performance.

4 lucky winners will go home with a Nintendo Switch or a PS5!

Sign-up now to save your seat!

Want to host a BreakBeatCode Hackathon Watch Party?

For teachers joining the event with your students in your classroom, no coding or music experience is required for you or your students.

You will need:

a stable internet connection

a projector with a connected speaker

laptops for each student (mobile phones and tablets are not supported by the platform)

ideally headphones (or it will get really noisy when they start making beats with code!)

Want to join the BreakBeatCode Hackathon from home?

For students attending the event alone, no coding or music experience is required. You will need a stable internet connection, a laptop (mobile phones and tablets are not supported by the platform), and headphones. Students who participate in the event and share their work will have a chance to win prizes for Best New for first time participants or Best Returning Artist-Engineer for participants from prior Hackathons.

Submit your remix, and you could win a PS5 or Nintendo Switch!
